subject: Economics
title: Net Neutrality: Should All Data Be Equal?
description: One-minute skill: Net Neutrality: Should All Data Be Equal?.

hook.text: What if your internet provider could slow Netflix to sell you its own streaming service? Net neutrality prevents.

buildup.text: Net neutrality: all internet traffic should be treated equally.

discovery.text: Without neutrality, ISPs become gatekeepers who pick winners. Startups that can't pay for fast lanes can't compete.

twist.text: ISPs argue paid prioritization funds network investment. Why should Netflix traffic be free when it uses 15% of all.

climax.text: Net neutrality is a fight over who controls the internet's economics: platforms, ISPs, or users.

punchline.text: Net neutrality asks a simple question: is the internet a utility or a product?

quiz.question: What does net neutrality require?
options: Internet providers must charge everyone the same price
All internet traffic must be treated equally
